title: Great place to work
pros: Management and staff are very professional and helpful. Management is mindful staff needs
cons: Nothing I can this of at this time

title: Good people
pros: Enjoyed working with talented people.
cons: Assets need more capital reinvestment. High turnover.

title: overall good company to work for
pros: Flexible schedule and great supervisors.
cons: Sometimes lack of communication between departments

title: great culture, welcoming people
pros: reasonable work life balance, opportunities to try different things
cons: known for paying lower salaries than peers

title: Failed to live up to “familial” expectation
pros: Great employees, interdepartmental support, training investment
cons: Lack of recognition for performance (favor seniority), inefficient software suite, stale senior leadership, lack of job security

title: Big Presence with Family Feel
pros: Federal's assets are something to behold and make you feel proud to support. Lead by an enthusiastic CEO, the culture of FRIT is a family feel, which leaves you excited to come to work each day and feel good about the work you're doing; that your work is making a difference. Raises and promotions are regularly celebrated across the company. It feels good to be recognized for the work you contribute.
cons: At times the different departments can feel a little too isolated and communication can fall short, however, this is something that has been discussed and is always trying to be improved. It's never difficult to reach someone in another department to help workout an issue.

title: Learn a lot-Work hard!
pros: Competitive salary, good benefits, nice people
cons: Understaffed and difficult to meet deadlines

title: FRIT
pros: Great work experience, nice team.
cons: They do not onboard very well.

title: Review
pros: This office was Family Oriented
cons: The management in this office needs help.

title: Federal has a great working environment!
pros: The people at Federal are amazing. I truly enjoy everyone that I work with. Benefits are really good. Corporate office is beautiful and in a great location.
cons: Not the most diverse executive team, though they are truly engaging and brilliant. High turnover in the past few years making it challenging.

title: Good company
pros: Supportive coworkers and managers. Benefits Dress code Free goodies
cons: Minimal contact with higher-ups if in a smaller position Less recognized compared to other workers.

title: FRIT Review
pros: -people -well capitalized -variety of assets -high profile assets
cons: -publicly traded -limited growth -departmentalized -simple business plans and corporate growth strategy

title: Great Company
pros: Company values its employees. They create a chance to make a difference
cons: None that I can think of

title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
pros: There is no better place to learn real estate. You will be working with dynamic real estate professionals who know and love what they do. Free gym onsite, free parking, kitchen with free coffee and sodas. Free breakfast weekly. Many parties and other activities with coworkers. Truly casual dress from the top down.
cons: No telecommuting even though most support staff positions are perfect candidates. Unless you are upper management you will work in an 80's era cubicle. Consultants and auditors work crammed together in windowless conference rooms. So-so benefits and a three year vesting cliff for 401k matches. Antiquated technology and a host of manual, labor-intensive processes. High rate of turnover.

title: Outstanding Leaders
pros: Federal hasn't gained its reputation for no reason. It is a company that challenges the status quo, makes sound decisions with the long-term vision always in mind and excellence can be seen in everything we do. I attribute all this to upper management; we are truly surrounded by industry superstars that you can learn a lot from. You just have to make it a point to do this. Also, the sense of pride in belonging to FRIT is a huge plus.
cons: Although it is admirable that we are technically small in size for all we do, that has its downsides. In my opinion, systems and technology are in desperate need for improvement (investing in efficiency will pay off in the long run), middle management needs to be carefully chosen (ability to manage needs to be looked at vs. years of service) and we must invest in more personnel (most departments seem to be spread too thin which makes it difficult for talented employees to think outside the box, shine and grow)

title: Most people are great, Benefits are awesome, Still give bonuses in this economic climate
pros: I really liked the personalities of most of the people I worked with. The work load was doable and there was minimal supervision, and when questions arose, they were answered promptly. The benefits are second to none. I was impressed that employees still received bonuses and raises, given the economic climate.
cons: When there are people underperforming, they are not reprimanded. At times, it seems like mediocrity is tolerated or sometimes encouraged. There was not any cross-department transitions, however much they emphasize it. While there are annual raises, the initial salary is low compared to similar positions at other companies.

title: An already excellent company, continuously striving to be better.
pros: What initially drew me to FRIT were its local properties, which change, grow and change again. It seemed that improvement was a priority, and after working here, I still believe that is so. This is a place people come and often stay. It is the least gossipy atmosphere I have ever worked in; friendly and real. FRIT mgmt. tries to listen, promote from within and to assist those who show interest in advancing.
cons: Probably the biggest "con" is also a big "pro" - longevity. Some people who've been here for years are eager and willing to change as needed, others forget to listen to those who have outside experience. Newer employees may be leery of consequences of rocking the boat.

title: Great introduction to real estate, but no one follows rules
pros: Great introduction, amazing benefits, good co workers
cons: They use antiquated software systems, poor communication all the way around, high turnover (mostly people leaving), meh salary, everything always seemed like an uphill battle, no accountability whatsoever, long hours during monthly and quarter end, split company between two buildings and no one seems to know how to adjust, poor training, seems like guidance is frowned upon. Left on good terms only to find out that my manager has trashed me ever since.

title: Truly a great place to work
pros: I've been given so many opportunities to learn and grow over the years. The team is generally lean which has given me the opportunity to be exposed to more than I would likely be exposed to elsewhere. Federal is fast paced, fun and there is a true sense of family among the team. Federal promotes a culture of out of the box thinking. The leadership team is open to listening to new ideas. Overall, there is a sense that people at Federal Realty not only care about the success of the company but they also genuinely care about one another. This is truly a great place to work. Pros: Competitive salary, excellent benefits, free bagels on Wednesday, free sodas, drinks, good coffee options, fun holiday parties and picnics, great leadership team.
cons: There is not always a vertical career path given the size of the company.

title: Big corporate scope, but limited insight
pros: FRIT engages in a lot of complex transactions and acquisitions, and has public company reporting requirements so everything is done by the book. This provides good opportunity for exposure in these areas but you have to fight for it. Health insurance was good and there are several events/occasions where employees are shown appreciation. Coworkers were friendly.
cons: If you are ambitious, you better be patient too. Did not seem like there was any room for promotion. Turnover is high because of this (e.g. read the other reviews). Seems as if most people are stuck (although some are content) being role players.

title: Great Company to Invest in; Poor Company to work for.
pros: The people who work here are very nice and talented. It is a leading REIT so recognition in the industry is great, made finding a new job easy. Free soda and bagel Wednesdays.
cons: Hours worked are above average for the industry and pay is below average. Not much opportunity for advancement, no traning provided, low morale, constant turnover. While my experience wasn't bad, it just wasn't a place that I could see a future. The company is focused on FFO and not on it's people.

title: Real estate professional
pros: Great balance sheet and some very intelligent people. They will spend money on projects and do things that others cannot b/c FRIT carries so little property-secured debt.
cons: Unnecessary culture of fear and favorites played. There is an inordinate amount of power consolidated at the COO level that is customarily spread throughout an organization - this would be good if the COO was open to suggestions and constructive criticism, but that is not the case.

title: Love where I work!
pros: The entrepreneurial culture at Federal fosters career growth. In my experience, you have the ability to dictate how much you want to grow and what career path you want to take. Put in the work, communicate and you will be given the opportunity to take on as much as you want. In addition, especially after Covid, I feel like the company really cares about its people. Federal is a wonderful place to be at.
cons: Communication amongst departments can be improved.

title: Low Growth Opportunity and Poor Work Life Balance
pros: Most of the people are friendly and make the environment a good place to be.
cons: There's no room for growth, especially in accounting and they door a poor job or highlighting or recognizing their employees. As the reporting demand increase or more properties are acquired or more developments begun they have no problem asking you to do more, but never reward you on the back end.

title: Good shop to gain insight in the industry
pros: Smart people with connections in the industry to do some interesting deals. I learned a lot in 3 years before jumping. This is a great place to get your foot in the door!
cons: Wish I had more resources even though the company does its best to give resources. Room to move up is tough because the deal guys have been around for ever which makes it difficult for junior guys to go up the chain.

title: Love it here!
pros: Wonderful place to work and great people to work with. They really seem to care about their employees and making the company better as a whole each day. The pay is solid and the benefits are super. Bagel Wednesdays help break up with week and refreshments are always stocked.
cons: Nothing really negative to say. Just be prepared to keep busy and work hard.

title: General Manager
pros: Great company to work for. FRIT has a great handle on the retail run and completely understands the pros and cons of retail. The FRIT motto is "Team Work" and everyone is always there to support you.
cons: The only con I could say is that more companies should model their success after the FRIT model.

title: Great Place to Work!!
pros: Simply put...Its just a great place to work! The people who work here make it that way. You will see that many people choose to work here for a long time because of how much they like it. Salaries are competitive, we get yearly bonuses, we have great benefits, a lot of perks, its a company that promotes core values, teambuilding, volunteering, health/fitness and is highly respected in the industry.
cons: Can't say that I have any.

title: Overall positive environment
pros: Leadership at Federal encourages growth within the company and encourages and entrepreneurial spirit. Thinking outside the box is rewarded and looked upon favorably. Also, the culture at Federal makes it feels like you're part of a big family. A lot of employees have worked there a long time and welcome new employees in with open arms.
cons: The salaries aren't as competitive as some of their peers, but the upward mobility potential and overall positive work environment make up for that.

title: Lots of egos
pros: Pay is good or better then other local RE companies.
cons: Revolving door, people come and go, management won't slow down a little to see/fix the problem. Good people are chased away, lots of bad ones are allowed to linger. I interviewed with a total of 7 people, all were gone in less then 1 year

title: Reach out to former employees before applying
pros: Management team seems to know what they're doing. Strong portfolio of shopping centers in the DMV area. Free bagels on Wednesdays...
cons: Several key people quit this year, and last year as well. Underlying employees generally lack professionalism and morale. Leadership isn't prevalent and guidance is frowned upon. Communication is lacking across all groups. Egos aren't checked at the door. Very difficult to grow and develop skills here. It's difficult for me to leave this review because the CEO, CFO and COO are professionals who I personally look up to. But, my overall experience was negative.

title: Great company!
pros: Very professional culture, great work life balance, good benefits, ethical in pursuit of goals. By far the best company I have worked for.
cons: I started this position during Covid lockdown so I became very used to working remote. Current policy is three days in the office. I would prefer more flexibility to work remotely, but being able to work from home a couple of days a week is still a great benefit.

title: Poorly run management, but they all think they are so amazing because they provide quarterly dividends
pros: salary usually competitive for area, company is only profitable due to properties/locations, but typically allow them to only look good from street, but peel away a few layers and you find they are actually quite run down. Lucky for them the locations attract good tenants.
cons: Does not listen to front line employees, executives seem to always know better and turn a blind eye when negative thing are brought to their attention. Executives, you should take the time to talk to your PM’s one on one and don’t leave it up to the poorly run HR Department, they kinda suck. Company wastes tons of money by its failure to communicate with their managers, company could pay its REIT investors soooo much more dividends if they would slow down just a bit and concentrate, stop thinking you are so smart and look a little closer at your employees you think are so great, they are not as good as you think. Company looses so many good quality hard working folks due to their unwillingness to listen and try to adjust a little when issues are pointed out. Top officials should be ashamed for taking so much compensation while they continue to allow great people to leave. Exit interviews conducted are a joke. Take time to talk to your tenants, you may be surprised at how negative they will be regarding their treatment by the company, lastly, if you are a tenant you should exercise your option to audit your CAM if your lease allows, you will be stunned at what you might find.

title: Collaborative Work Environment
pros: Plenty of work in the pipeline. Great relationships with retailers. High standards. Interesting array of work across many states.
cons: Many cooks in the kitchen. Difficult to get a sense for who's responsibility it is to get things done. Work with lots of consultants criss crossing and blurring lines.

title: Solid company. Lacks management skills.
pros: Very well established and structured company.
cons: Promoted managers have very little/no "management training".

title: Overall positive experience
pros: FRIT owns and develops high quality shopping centers and mixed use assets. Given its smaller size, people have the opportunity to move around laterally, work on different kinds of projects and make an impact.
cons: Little emphasis placed on career development and data management systems are outdated.

title: Lease Adminstrator
pros: Great benefits and a good salary. Corporate had a gym on location and days off were normal.
cons: I moved out of state so could not keep the job. I would say that management needs to let go of the reigns a bit.

title: Fast Faced Organization with Excellent Culture
pros: Federal Realty is a great company to work for if you want to be challenged, a part of a team, and be given opportunities to learn and advance your career.
cons: Some delays in upward mobility and promotion within certain departments.

title: WORK-life balance
pros: Good Benefits, competitive salary, fast paced, diverse work force, great people!
cons: Long hours, heavy workload, Not much room for growth in many departments.

title: Great Company to work for!
pros: Good pay, benefits, management, and CEO. Great overall commitment to making sure their employees needs are met. They really care about work/life balance for their employees (especially in the difficult COVID time).
cons: Nothing negative can be said about this company.

title: Amazing culture and leadership
pros: strong leadership, great work life balance (usually), fun team events
cons: work can be a little overwhelming during crunch times, but expected in a financial role

title: Federal Realty Investment Trust Review
pros: direct supervisor is family oriented and caring, people are friendly, great benefits, free soda and coffee
cons: not much upward mobility, questionable compensation (some people overpaid, some underpaid)

title: General tech 2
pros: Benefits, work enviroment, pay vacations and pay sick time.
cons: Low pay, lack of opportunity to grow.

title: Small company, big scale!
pros: Personal attention, collaboration, opportunity to grow and work cross funtionally
cons: No parenthood leave beyond FMLA, small scale means less positions for promotion, no ESPP match

title: Great company
pros: Excellent leadership, beautiful work space, supportive work-life balance culture, family oriented, and rich benefits package.
cons: No cons. Federal Realty and its leaders are top notch in all aspects.

title: Wonderful company to work for. Flat organizational structure.
pros: Fantastic mentorship of younger staff members and future stars.
cons: Compensation a bit below market, but opportunities for growth outweigh this con.

title: Construction Manager
pros: Stable Growth and Corporate Strategies that command significant market share and development.
cons: truction Manager

title: A great place
pros: Professional, laid back but active and friendly environment. Great higher and low management!
cons: Low pay for all responsibilities, not fully accommodating physical settings.

title: Wonderful place to work
pros: Some of the pros were my coworkers and the relationships I built
cons: some of the cons would be the excessive amount of pressure

title: Good intro into Commercial Real Estate
pros: Easy day to day tasks
cons: Not much room for advancement

title: Listens to employees
pros: Benefits, pay, and great working atmosphere.
cons: None in the year I have been here.

title: Great Company
pros: Excellent benefits, great location, parking and next to the T station!
cons: a lot of the software programs are dated

title: Positive experience
pros:
- competitive salary
- amicable co-workers
cons:
- end of quarter is hectic
- not a lot of room for advancement

title: Good company to work for!
pros: Family friendly company, peaceful work environment.
cons: None that I can think of.

title: Great Company
pros: Tremendous support team. Great Benefits
cons: There are no down side to working with this company.

title: FRIT
pros: Beat in class properties, great bonus if your in a senior position
cons: Lack of Diversity for people of color

title: Amazing Employer/Work Environment
pros: fairly treats employees, good pay, great benefits
cons: none that I have yet come across

title: Great Company
pros: Advancement Opportunities, growth, online learning tools
cons: little to no onboard training for programs and systems

title: Director
pros: Great company; great product; great people.
cons: Too many meetings that interfered with productivity.

title: Infrastructure
pros: Seems like a good platform.
cons: Unreliable infrastucture,to big to fast.

title: Good Company
pros: Great work environment, management is good
cons: Not a lot of room advancement

title: Marketing
pros: Great company to work for
cons: Old school mentality in the office

title: Mid level
pros: Large Company with relatively good benefits
cons: Low salaried compared to other companies, disorganization, poor management choices, little assistance from HR, low employee morale, constant reorganization,

title: None
pros: I got to various with various teams
cons: I am so glad that I left this company

title: Good for shareholders, bad for employees.
pros: Mostly nice people, good stock performance.
cons: FRIT openly admits that they ask for very high performance from their employees while paying less than competitors. In other words, employees are overworked and underpaid. But that's essential for them to maintain their competitive advantage as the REIT with the longest record of annual dividend rate increases. They will do whatever it takes to hold onto that record, including laying off employees when the workload actually calls for additional hires. Most jobs with FRIT are not secure, especially in the current market. They are also transparent about their expectations that you perform the duties of a higher position before getting a promotion or raise. FRIT expects you to prove you can do the work first to earn that higher title and pay. However, they tend to take advantage of this and let employees continue to do extra work without giving them that promotion. They're walking a fine line with the legality of this practice, but they always come up with excuses to make it seem legitimate and justified. Shareholders can feel pretty secure about their investment choice. Employees should recognize that they'll never be prioritized and find a workplace that can provide them with a better environment. One problem with the workload at FRIT is a major lack of systems. Their business processes have not grown as fast as their portfolio. They operate with outdated and inefficient methods and their offices/teams are disconnected from each other. This leaves employees too overwhelmed with tedious daily tasks to achieve any kind of innovation. The management says they're open to new ideas but they do not foster an environment that allows for developing new methods, trying things that could prove unsuccessful, or time available to review any recommendations. Those who do try to focus on innovation don't last long with FRIT. FRIT does have good people; Many smart business people who mean well and executives who are actually approachable. They have lots of loyal employees who stick around because they remember how good things were when it was a smaller company (or they just don't have the time/initiative to find a new job). Unfortunately, the good intentions of FRIT don't translate to creating a good work environment. I would not recommend working at FRIT.

title: Solid performance, but horrible employee retention and moral.
pros: REIT understands its bottom line and is focused on results. Could be a fantastic company to work for if the firm intelligently communicated and invested in its employees. Unfortunately, this is its achilles heel.
cons: Disfunctional interoffice communication. Poor training. Horrendous employee retention rate. While sr. mgt. is great at attaining company directives, little effort is invested in cultivating or motivating performing talent. Many talented individuals leave due to the firm's inability to communicate honestly in a forthright manner. Although senior mgt is for the most part talented, certain key roles are currently posted by "pretenders". A solid firm should be able to recognize such liabilities and root them out.

title: A well run Retail REIT
pros: Great opportunity to really understand a well run Retail REIT. Employees and colleagues are professional and respectful of one another.
cons: The management style from the top down is one that is focused on results more than people. In this economy, the company is less of a risk taker than it has been in the past, which is good for shareholders and probably good for long term stability, but hard on the people who are working there.

title: The company does excellent work but demands a lot from its employees and rewards high achievers.
pros: Pays well, smart management, good benefits, good growth opportunities. It's a good place to work for ambitious, hard-working individuals, who are team players and are prepared to work a lot.
cons: This is not specific to this company, but it has a sink or swim mentality. If you're not excellent you might be summarily terminated - but that's not surprising.
